lines.text: I will now play a passage from a famous opera, and you must name the opera.
But... but I'm weary.
Listen carefully!
[plays a single note on piano]
And there you have it! Now, what's the opera?
C-Cavalleria Rusticana?
Audience?
Rigoletto!
Who was the Father of our country?
Th-That's easy! G-George W-Wash...
[Alarm clock rings, Daffy hits Porky repeatedly with mallet]
Aw, I'm sorry! Time's up! You don't get the Super Chief, but you're still the winner of the Rocky Mountains, a 17-jeweled Half Nelson, and the La Brea Tar Pits!
L-Lucky me!
This program is brought to you by the Eagle Hands Laundry. Does your eagle have dirty mitts?
Listen, bub, you've got 32 teeth, would you like to try for 16?
Are you th-th-threatening me, because I...
HHHHHHHEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEELLLLLLLLLLLLLPPPPPPPPPP! This cry for help has been brought to you by the Eagle Hand Laundry.
Pardon me, but may I have my jackpot?
Oh, well, fair is fair.
[giving Porky a cauldron]
Here's you pot, Jack.
B-but my name's isn't Jack
It's not? Oh, I'm sorry. This pot was made for Jack. Jack-pot, get it? Your name isn't Jack, so you must pay the penalty!

[on a conveyor belt, about to be cut by a buzzsaw]
T-the cotton gin was invented by Eli Whitney.

[stops the buzzsaw]
You're absolutely correct! And let me remind you again, folks, that you're listening to Truth or -Aaaugh! Brought to you by the Eagle Hand Laundry. If your eagle's hands are dirty, we'll wash them clean. Now, back to our contestant. Mwahahahah!
What was Cleopatra's aunt's maiden name?
Which one? Her maternal aunt, or her paternal?
Here, watch your language, bud. We're on the air.
In my hand you'll notice I hold two buzzers. You must push one. Hurry now. Which one? Quick! Good, clean, wholesome fun!
[Porky pushes one buzzer; a safe falls on him]
You're a great sport. A great sport!
C-could I please take my prizes and g-go home now? I-I'm not feeling too well.
And for being such a great sport, I'm going to let you push the other button and win a prize. Come on, now. Don't be bashful. Push.
[Porky pushes the other buzzer; a huge boulder falls on him]
And the gentleman wins the Rock of Gibraltar! And that's not all. The gentleman also wins six hundred gallons of genuine Niagara Falls.
[Water falls on Porky]
Give the lucky winner a hand, folks.
Guess who Miss Shush is and I'll give you 26 million dollars and three cents.
W-w-well, now, I...
Here's the clue. This is the sound of Miss Shush brushing her teeth on Wednesday.
[plays record]
Now who is Miss Shush?
L-L-Lauren Bacall?
Oh, I'm sorry. But don't be discouraged. Miss Shush is right here in this studio, and I'm going to let you meet her. The famous movie star, Miss Shush!
[Opens dressing room door]
Oh b-b-boy! I-I'll add to my autograph collection.
[Enters]
Miss Shush is in there, all right, but what I didn't tell him was that Miss Shush is really Mamie, the 600-pound gorilla, who appears in Obnoxious Pictures' "Jungle Jitters."
[Offstage growls and thrashing sounds]
Next contestant, please.
And for being such a good sport, I'm going to give you the 26 million dollars and three cents.

[on phone]
H-hello, I would like to speak to the president of the Ajax Broadcasting Company.
[pause]
H-hello? How much will you take for your television network?
[pause]
Eh, 26 million dollars and three cents? Sold!

[uneasy]
Hello, boss.
[gulps]

[snatches Daffy's answer sheet]
In w-what latitude and l-longitude did the wreck of the Hesperus occur?
Well, I...

[hits Daffy repeatedly with a mallet]
Oh, I'm sorry. Time's up. So y-you must pay the penalty.
Anyone for tennis?
[water, a safe, and a boulder fall on Daffy]

[on the conveyor belt of the buzzsaw]
Have you got a doctor on the balcony, lady?
